intro: Fagara mauiensis var. lanaiensis, commonly known as the Maui fern tree, is a rare plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and distinctive, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in coastal and lowland forests. Its leaves are usually leathery and dark green, with a rough texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
